Description: Fragment from a pottery grill stand. Smoothed surface, no glaze.Two rows of triangular cut-outs (lower row with pierced centres) and scalloped top. Slightly curving; on inside, remains of three rectangular struts at base. Red-brown clay with much silver mica, some lime inclusions and some small to large stones/sand (some at least quartz), 2.5YR5/6-YR5/6.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For a similar grill, in the shape of a fish, from Miletos, see Aydemir 2005, 92-4, fig. 12, p. 98 no. 5 , from levels said to date to the early 5th century BC. Aydemir, A. 2005, ‘Funde aus Milet: XX. Kochgeschirr und Küchengeräte aus dem archaischen Milet’, Archäologischer Anzeiger, 85–101.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GV.01)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5855 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
